data.name: ElementGrouping.AddElement.TransactionName
data.comment: The transaction name used when adding an element to a group.

data.name: ElementGrouping.AddGroup.TransactionName
data.comment: The transaction name used when adding a group.

data.name: ElementGrouping.DefaultNamePattern
data.comment: The base name used to create a name for a new ElementGrouping. This is a format string with {0} being the placeholder for the number placement.

data.name: ElementGrouping.RemoveElementExclusion.TransactionName
data.comment: The transaction name used when removing an explicitly excluded element from a group.

data.name: ElementGroupingTypes.PropertyDescriptor.Description
data.value: Select group types to control content and associate behavior with elements in this Group.
data.comment: Description shown in the properties window for the 'GroupTypes' property of an ElementGrouping.

data.name: ElementGroupingTypes.PropertyDescriptor.DisplayName
data.comment: Display name shown in the properties window for the 'GroupTypes' property of an ElementGrouping.

data.name: ElementGroupingTypes.PropertyDescriptor.TransactionName
data.comment: The transaction name used when modifying the set of types associated with a group

data.name: ExclusiveOrConstraint.ClassName
data.comment: Text used as the class name, displayed in the properties window.

data.name: ExclusiveOrConstraint.ExclusionConstraintName.DisplayName
data.comment: Text used as the name for Name property of the coupled exclusion constraint, displayed in the properties window.

data.name: ExclusiveOrConstraint.MandatoryConstraintName.DisplayName
data.comment: Text used as the name for Name property of the coupled mandatory constraint, displayed in the properties window.

data.name: FactType.RemoveImpliedInternalUniquenessConstraints.TransactionName
data.comment: The name of the transaction that auto-fixes implied and duplicate internal constraints.

data.name: FrequencyConstraint.ConvertToUniquenessConstraint.TransactionName
data.comment: The name of the transaction that converts a frequency constraint to a uniqueness.

data.name: FrequencyConstraint.UnboundedMaxValueText
data.comment: Text used in the dropdown editor and type converter for the frequency constraint max value. Correspond to the 0 value in the object model.

data.name: GroupingMembershipTypeCompliance.NotExcluded
data.comment: Displayed enum value for group membership type compliance. Allow all elements that are not explicitly excluded by any GroupType.

data.name: GroupingMembershipTypeCompliance.PartiallyApproved
data.comment: Displayed enum value for group membership type compliance. Allow all elements that are approved by at least one associated type GroupType.

data.name: GroupingMembershipTypeCompliance.FullyApproved
data.comment: Displayed enum value for group membership type compliance. Allow all elements that are approved by all associated GroupTypes.

data.name: ImplicitBooleanValueType.PropertyRestriction
data.value: The modification of the IsImplicitBooleanValue property on a ValueType is not allowed.
data.comment: Error message for when a user attempts to modify properties on an Implicit Boolean ValueType

data.name: ImplicitBooleanValueType.Restriction
data.value: The modification of properties on an Implicit Boolean ValueType is not allowed.
data.comment: Error message for when a user attempts to modify the IsImplicitBooleanValueType property on a ValueType

data.name: ImplicitBooleanValueType.NoReadingFormatString
data.comment: The format string for naming an implicit boolean value type when there are no readings on the fact type.

data.name: ImpliedFactType.PredicateInverseReading
data.comment: The inverse reading for the predicate created implicitly via objectification. There is no attempt made to keep the predicate readings unique in ring situations.We allow the model error to populate instead of generating an articial unique reading.

data.name: ImpliedFactType.PredicateReading
data.comment: The reading for the predicate created implicitly via objectification.There is no attempt made to keep the predicate readings unique in ring situations.We allow the model error to populate instead of generating an articial unique reading.

data.name: LoadException.IncompatibleAssembly
data.value: The following extension assembly is not compatible with this version of NORMA and must be replaced with a compatible version before it can be loaded. {0}
data.comment: Exception text used when a NORMA extension fails a compatibility check.

data.name: LoadException.InvalidLoadKey
data.value: The registered extension type '{0}' has a missing or invalid extension load key and cannot be safely used in NORMA.
data.comment: Exception text used when a NORMA extension fails because of a missing or invalid load key.

data.name: Model.Reading.RoleDeletedText
data.comment: Text used to replace a role place holder when the role is deleted

data.name: ModelContextWindow.WindowTitle
data.comment: Text to place in the title bar of the context tool window.

data.name: ModelError.CalculatedPathValue.CalculatedPathValueRequiresAggregationContext.CompactText
data.value: An aggregation function requires an aggregation context.
data.comment: Model validation error text for an aggregate calculation with no aggregation context. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.CalculatedPathValue.CalculatedPathValueRequiresAggregationContext.Text
data.comment: Model validation error text for an aggregate calculation with no aggregation context. {0}=error display context

data.name: ModelError.CalculatedPathValue.CalculatedPathValueRequiresFunction.CompactText
data.value: A calculation must specify a function.
data.comment: Model validation error text for a path calculation without no specified function. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.CalculatedPathValue.CalculatedPathValueRequiresFunction.Text
data.value: {0} has a calculation with no function.
data.comment: Model validation error text for a path calculation without no specified function. {0}=error display context

data.name: ModelError.CalculatedPathValue.CalculatedPathValueParameterBinding.CompactText
data.comment: Model validation error text for a path calculation with no binding for some parameter. Compact form. {0}=parameter name

data.name: ModelError.CalculatedPathValue.CalculatedPathValueParameterBinding.Text
data.comment: Model validation error text for a path calculation with no binding for some parameter. {0}=error display context,{1}=parameter name

data.name: ModelError.CalculatedPathValue.CalculatedPathValueMustBeConsumed.CompactText
data.value: A calculation result must be used as a path condition, calculation input, or projection source.
data.comment: Model validation error text for a path calculation with a result that is not being used. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.CalculatedPathValue.CalculatedPathValueMustBeConsumed.Text
data.value: {0} must use a calculation result as a path condition, calculation input, or projection source.
data.comment: Model validation error text for a path calculation with a result that is not being used. {0}=error display context

data.name: ModelError.CardinalityConstraint.CardinalityRangeOverlapError.CompactMessage
data.value: Cardinality ranges have overlapping or non-increasing values.
data.comment: CardinalityRangeOverlapError compact text

data.name: ModelError.CardinalityConstraint.CardinalityRangeOverlapError.Message
data.value: {0} has a cardinality constraint with overlapping or non-increasing values.
data.comment: CardinalityRangeOverlapError text with owner place holder. The resulting sentence will be capitablized automatically. {0}=owner information

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.CompatibleRolePlayerTypeError.Set.CompactText
data.value: Constrained roles have incompatible role player types.
data.comment: The role players in an external constraint must have compatible types. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.CompatibleRolePlayerTypeError.Set.Text
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' has role players with incompatible types.
data.comment: The role players in an external constraint must have compatible types. Replacement field {0} is the constraint name and {1} is the model name.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.CompatibleRolePlayerTypeError.SetComparison.CompactText
data.value: Role players in column '{0}' have incompatible types.
data.comment: The role players in an external constraint column must have compatible types. Compact form. {0} is the (1-based) column number.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.CompatibleRolePlayerTypeError.SetComparison.Text
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' has role players in column '{2}' with incompatible types.
data.comment: The role players in an external constraint column must have compatible types. Replacement field {0} is the constraint name, {1} is the model name, and {2} is the (1-based) column number.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ContradictionError.Text
data.value: Constraints {0} in model '{1}' are in a state of contradiction.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a constraint intersects a second constraint where the second constraints roles are a subset of the constraint roles and are in a state of contradiction.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ExclusionAndMandatoryContradiction.CompactText
data.value: Overlapping exclusion and mandatory constraints are contradictory.
data.comment: Model validation error text when overlapping exclusion and mandatory constraint are contradictory. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ExclusionAndEqualityContradiction.CompactText
data.value: Overlapping exclusion and equality constraints are contradictory.
data.comment: Model validation error text when overlapping exclusion and equality constraints are contradictory. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ExclusionAndSubsetContradiction.CompactText
data.value: Overlapping exclusion and subset constraints are contradictory.
data.comment: Model validation error text when overlapping exclusion and subset constraints are contradictory. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.EqualityImpliedByMandatoryError.CompactText
data.value: Equality constraint implied by mandatory constrained roles.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a single-column equality constraint is put on a set of mandatory roles. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.EqualityImpliedByMandatoryError.Text
data.value: Equality constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' is implied by simple mandatory constraints on all roles in the constraint.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a single-column equality constraint is put on a set of mandatory roles.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ExternalConstraintArityMismatch.CompactText
data.value: Constrained role sequences have different numbers of roles.
data.comment: Model validation error compact text when role sequences in a multi column constraint have different role counts (arity).

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ExternalConstraintArityMismatch.Text
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' has role sequences with different numbers of roles.
data.comment: Model validation error text when role sequences in a multi column constraint have different role counts (arity). {0}=constraint name, {1}=model name

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.FrequencyConstraintExactlyOneError.CompactText
data.value: A frequency constraint with range of exactly one should be a uniqueness constraint.
data.comment: The frequency constraint has minimum and maximum values of exactly one, should be represented as a uniqueness constraint. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.FrequencyConstraintExactlyOneError.Text
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' has a range of exactly one, should be a uniqueness constraint.
data.comment: The frequency constraint has minimum and maximum values of exactly one, should be represented as a uniqueness constraint. {0}=constraint name {1}=model name

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.FrequencyConstraintMinMaxError.CompactText
data.value: Maximum frequency value cannot be less than minimum.
data.comment: The frequency constraint minimum must be less than or equal to the maximum. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.FrequencyConstraintMinMaxError.Text
data.value: Maximum value for constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' cannot be less than the minimum value.
data.comment: The frequency constraint minimum must be less than or equal to the maximum. {0}=constraint name {1}=model name

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.FrequencyConstraintNonRestrictiveRangeError.CompactText
data.value: An unbounded range with a minimum of one is always satisfied.
data.comment: A frequency constraint with a minimum of 1 and an unbounded maximum is always true and should not be specified. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.FrequencyConstraintNonRestrictiveRangeError.Text
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' has an unbounded range with a minimum of one. This frequency pattern is always satisfied.
data.comment: A frequency constraint with a minimum of 1 and an unbounded maximum is always true and should not be specified. {0}=constraint name {1}=model name

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.FrequencyConstraintViolatedByUniquenessConstraintError.CompactText
data.value: Frequency constraint is violated by a uniqueness constraint on the same roles.
data.comment: Model validation error text used when a frequency constraint is places on the same roles as a uniqueness constraint. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.FrequencyConstraintViolatedByUniquenessConstraintError.Text
data.value: Frequency constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' is violated by a uniqueness constraint on the same roles.
data.comment: Model validation error text used when a frequency constraint is places on the same roles as a uniqueness constraint. {0}=constraint name {1}=model name

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ImplicationError.ImpliedBySubsetText
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' is implied by at least one constraint of the same type attached to a subset of the same roles.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a constraint intersects a second constraint where the second constraint's roles are a subset of the constraint roles.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ImplicationError.ImpliedBySubsetCompactText
data.value: Constraint is implied by a constraint of the same type attached to a subset of the same roles.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a constraint intersects a second constraint where the second constraint's roles are a subset of the constraint roles. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ImplicationError.ImpliedBySupersetText
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' is implied by at least one constraint of the same type attached to a superset of the same roles.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a constraint intersects a second constraint where the second constraint's roles are a superset of the constraint roles.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ImplicationError.ImpliedBySupersetCompactText
data.value: Constraint is implied by a constraint of the same type attached to a superset of the same roles.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a constraint intersects a second constraint where the second constraint's roles are a superset of the constraint roles. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.NotWellModeledSubsetAndMandatoryError.CompactText
data.value: Overlapping subset and mandatory constraints are not both needed.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a mandatory constraint is put on the subset role of a subset constraint relationship. Compact form

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.NotWellModeledSubsetAndMandatoryError.Text
data.value: Subset constraint '{0}' and mandatory constraint '{1}' in model '{2}' are not well-modeled. Suggested ways to fix: (1) Delete the mandatory constraint. (2) Add another mandatory constraint on the superset role. (3) Delete the subset constraint.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a mandatory constraint is put on the subset role of a subset constraint relationship.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.RingConstraintTypeNotSpecifiedError.CompactMessage
data.value: A ring type must be specified.
data.comment: The ring constraint type must be specified. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.RingConstraintTypeNotSpecifiedError.Message
data.value: The ring type for ring constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' is not specified.
data.comment: The ring constraint type must be specified. {0} is the constraint name and {1} is the model name.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.SubsetImpliedByMandatoryError.CompactText
data.value: Subset constraint implied by mandatory superset role.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a single-column subset constraint targets a mandatory role. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.SubsetImpliedByMandatoryError.Text
data.value: Subset constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' is implied by a simple mandatory constraint on the superset role.
data.comment: Model validation error text when a single-column subset constraint targets a mandatory role.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.SupersetRoleOfSubtypeSubsetConstraintNotSubtypeError.CompactText
data.value: Subset constraint from a subtyping relationship must not be to role with a subtype role player.
data.comment: When a subset constraint goes from a subtype relationship to an normal role, the role player must not be a subtype of the role player for that role. This would indicates that the supertype must be a subset of one of its subtypes. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.SupersetRoleOfSubtypeSubsetConstraintNotSubtypeError.Text
data.value: Subset constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' is from a subtype and has a superset role player that is a subtype of the supertype in that relationship.
data.comment: When a subset constraint goes from a subtype relationship to an normal role, the role player must not be a subtype of the role player for that role. This would indicates that the supertype must be a subset of one of its subtypes. Replacement field {0} is the constraint name, {1} is the model name.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewRoleSequences.ExactlyTwo
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' requires exactly two constrained role sequences.{2}
data.comment: Model validation error text when too few role sequences are specified for a constraint that requires exactly two role sequences. {0}=constraint name, {1}=model name, {2}=addendum describing current sequence state for the constraint.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewRoleSequences.ExactlyTwo.Compact
data.value: Constraint requires exactly two role sequences.{0}
data.comment: Model validation error text when too few role sequences are specified for a constraint that requires exactly two role sequences. Compact form. {0}=addendum describing current sequence state for the constraint.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewRoleSequences.TwoOrMore
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' requires two or more constrained role sequences.{2}
data.comment: Model validation error text when too few role sequences are specified for a constraint that requires multiple role sequences. {0}=constraint name, {1}=model name, {2}=addendum describing current sequence state for the constraint.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewRoleSequences.TwoOrMore.Compact
data.value: Constraint requires two or more role sequences.{0}
data.comment: Model validation error text when too few role sequences are specified for a constraint that requires multiple role sequences. Compact form. {0}=addendum describing current sequence state for the constraint.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewRoleSequences.NoSequenceAddendum
data.value: No role sequences are currently constrained.
data.comment: Addendum for too few role sequences messages when no sequences are constrained.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewRoleSequences.NoSequenceAddendum.Compact
data.comment: Addendum for too few role sequences messages when no sequences are constrained. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewRoleSequences.OneSequenceAddendum
data.value: One role sequence with {0} role(s) is currently constrained.
data.comment: Addendum for too few role sequences messages when one sequence is constrained. {0}=count of roles in the single sequence.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewRoleSequences.OneSequenceAddendum.Compact
data.comment: Addendum for too few role sequences messages when one sequence is constrained. Compact form. {0}=count of roles in the single sequence.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewSequenceRoles.ExactlyTwo
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' requires exactly two roles.{2}
data.comment: Model validation error text when too few roles are specified for a constraint with a single role sequence requiring exactly two roles. {0}=constraint name, {1}=model name, {2}=addendum describing current role count for the constraint.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewSequenceRoles.ExactlyTwo.Compact
data.comment: Model validation error text when too few roles are specified for a constraint with a single role sequence requiring exactly two roles. Compact form. {0}=addendum describing current role count for the constraint.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewSequenceRoles.TwoOrMore
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' requires two or more roles.{2}
data.comment: Model validation error text when too few roles are specified for a constraint with a single role sequence requiring two or more roles. {0}=constraint name, {1}=model name, {2}=addendum describing current role count for the constraint.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewSequenceRoles.TwoOrMore.Compact
data.value: Constraint requires two or more roles.{0}
data.comment: Model validation error text when too few roles are specified for a constraint with a single role sequence requiring two or more roles. Compact form. {0}=addendum describing current role count for the constraint.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewSequenceRoles.NoRoleAddendum
data.comment: Addendum for too few sequence roles messages when no roles are constrained.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewSequenceRoles.NoRoleAddendum.Compact
data.comment: Addendum for too few sequence roles messages when no roles are constrained. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewSequenceRoles.OneRoleAddendum
data.value: A single role is currently constrained.
data.comment: Addendum for too few sequence roles messages when a single role is constrained.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooFewSequenceRoles.OneRoleAddendum.Compact
data.comment: Addendum for too few sequence roles messages when a single role is constrained. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooManyRoleSequences.CompactText
data.value: Constraint compares too many role sequences.
data.comment: Model validation error text when too many role sequences are specified for a constraint. This is an uncommon condition that should only occur with a hand edit to a model file. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.TooManyRoleSequences.Text
data.value: Constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' has too many role sequences.
data.comment: Model validation error text when too many role sequences are specified for a constraint. This is an uncommon condition that should only occur with a hand edit to a model file. {0}=constraint name, {1}=model name

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ValueComparisonConstraintOperatorTypeNotSpecifiedError.CompactMessage
data.value: A comparison operator must be specified.
data.comment: The value comparison constraint operator must be specified. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ValueComparisonConstraintOperatorTypeNotSpecifiedError.Message
data.value: The comparison operator for value comparison constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' is not specified.
data.comment: The value comparison constraint operator must be specified. {0} is the constraint name and {1} is the model name.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ValueComparisonRolesNotComparableError.CompactMessage
data.value: Compared roles must resolve to the same unit or to value types with comparable data types.
data.comment: The two value comparison constraint roles must be single-valued and comparable. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.Constraint.ValueComparisonRolesNotComparableError.Message
data.value: The roles compared by value comparison constraint '{0}' in model '{1}' must resolve to the same unit or to value types with comparable data types.
data.comment: The two value comparison constraint roles must be single-valued and comparable. {0} is the constraint name and {1} is the model name.

data.name: ModelError.ConstraintRoleProjection.IncompatibleProjection.CompactText
data.value: The role player of a constrained role is incompatible with the join path projection.
data.comment: Model validation error text for projection on a constraint role from a join path where the type of projection does not match the type of the constrained role. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.ConstraintRoleProjection.IncompatibleProjection.Text
data.value: {0} has a constrained role with an incompatible join path projection.
data.comment: Model validation error text for projection on a constraint role from a join path where the type of projection does not match the type of the constrained role. {0}=error display context (from join path)

data.name: ModelError.ConstraintRoleSequenceJoinPath.ConstraintRoleSequenceJoinPathRequiresProjection.CompactText
data.value: At least one join path must be projected on constrained roles.
data.comment: Model validation error text for a constraint join path with no path projection. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.ConstraintRoleSequenceJoinPath.ConstraintRoleSequenceJoinPathRequiresProjection.Text
data.value: {0} must project constrained roles from at least one join path.
data.comment: Model validation error text for a constraint join path with no path projection. {0}=error display context

data.name: ModelError.ConstraintRoleSequenceJoinPath.PartialConstraintRoleSequenceJoinPathProjection.CompactText
data.value: All constrained roles must be projected from each projected join path.
data.comment: Model validation error text for a constraint join path projection that does not project all constraint roles. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.ConstraintRoleSequenceJoinPath.PartialConstraintRoleSequenceJoinPathProjection.Text
data.value: {0} must project all constrained roles from each projected join path.
data.comment: Model validation error text for a constraint join path projection that does not project all constraint roles. {0}=error display context

data.name: ModelError.DerivedRoleProjection.IncompatibleProjection.CompactText
data.value: A role player is incompatible with the derivation rule projection.
data.comment: Model validation error text for projection on a role from a derived fact type where the type of projection does not match the type of the role. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.DerivedRoleProjection.IncompatibleProjection.Text
data.value: {0} has a derivation projection with an incompatible type.
data.comment: Model validation error text for projection on a role from a derived fact type where the type of projection does not match the type of the role. {0}=error display context (from role)

data.name: ModelError.ElementGrouping.DuplicateNameError.CompactMessage
data.value: Group name '{0}' is used by multiple groups.
data.comment: Model validation error text used when multiple groups with the same name are loaded into a model. Compact form. field 0 is the element name. This is an uncommon condition that should only occur with a hand edit to a model file.

data.name: ModelError.ElementGrouping.DuplicateNameError.Message
data.value: Model '{0}' contains multiple groups named '{1}'. Group names must be unique in the model.
data.comment: Model validation error text used when multiple groups with the same name are loaded into a model. Field 0 is the model name, field 1 is the element name.This is an uncommon condition that should only occur with a hand edit to a model file.

data.name: ModelError.ElementGrouping.MembershipContradictionError.CompactMessage
data.value: Group types conflict on membership of '{0}'.
data.comment: Model validation error text used when an element is explicitly included by one grouptype and explicitly excluded by another. Compact form. Field 0 is the element name.

data.name: ModelError.ElementGrouping.MembershipContradictionError.Message
data.value: Group types for group '{0}' conflict on the group membership of '{1}'.
data.comment: Model validation error text used when an element is explicitly included by one grouptype and explicitly excluded by another. Field 0 is the group name, field 1 is the element name.

data.name: ModelError.EntityType.RequiresReferenceScheme.CompactMessage
data.value: Entity type requires a reference scheme.
data.comment: Compact message for an entity type must have a preferred reference scheme.

data.name: ModelError.EntityType.RequiresReferenceScheme.Message
data.value: Entity type '{0}' in model '{1}' requires a local preferred reference scheme or supertype(s) that provide preferred identification.
data.comment: An entity type must have a preferred reference scheme. Replacement field {0} is the entity type name and {1} is the model name.

data.name: ModelError.EntityTypeInstance.ObjectifiedInstanceRequired.CompactMessage
data.comment: Text displayed when an objectified fact instance is not associated with an external identifying instance. Compact form. {0}=instance

data.name: ModelError.EntityTypeInstance.ObjectifiedInstanceRequired.Message
data.value: Objectified fact instance required for instance '{0}' of '{1}' in model '{2}'.
data.comment: Text displayed when an objectified fact instance is not associated with an external identifying instance. {0}=instance, {1}=entitytype, {2}=model.

data.name: ModelError.EntityTypeInstance.TooFewEntityTypeRoleInstances.CompactMessage
data.comment: Text displayed when there aren't enough entity type role instances to completely fill a single entity population row. Compact form {0}=instance.

data.name: ModelError.EntityTypeInstance.TooFewEntityTypeRoleInstances.Message
data.value: '{0}' instance '{1}' in model '{2}' has an incomplete identifier.
data.comment: Text displayed when there aren't enough entity type role instances to completely fill a single entity population row. {0}=entitytype, {1}=instance, {2}=model.

data.name: ModelError.FactType.ImpliedInternalUniquenessConstraintError.CompactText
data.value: Some internal uniqueness constraint(s) duplicate or imply each other.
data.comment: Text used in the ImpliedInternalUniquenessConstraintError'. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.FactType.ImpliedInternalUniquenessConstraintError.Text
data.value: {0} contains one or more internal uniqueness constraints that are implied by or duplicates of other internal uniqueness constraints.
data.comment: Text used in the ImpliedInternalUniquenessConstraintError'. {0}=fact type display context

data.name: ModelError.FactType.NMinusOneRule.CompactText
data.value: Internal uniqueness constraint must span at least {0} roles.
data.comment: Text diplayed in the Model Error when the span of the internal constraint is less than the span of the Fact Type - 1. Compact form. {0}=factarity - 1

data.name: ModelError.FactType.NMinusOneRule.Text
data.value: Uniqueness constraint '{0}' on {1} must span at least {2} roles.
data.comment: Text diplayed in the Model Error when the span of the internal constraint is less than the span of the Fact Type - 1. {0}=constraint name, {1}=fact type display context, {2}=factarity-1

data.name: ModelError.FactType.RequiresInternalUniquenessConstraint.CompactMessage
data.value: Fact type requires an internal uniqueness constraint with alethic modality.
data.comment: Text displayed in the text of the FactTypeRequiresInternalUniquenessContraintError. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.FactType.RequiresInternalUniquenessConstraint.Message
data.value: {0} requires an internal uniqueness constraint with alethic modality.
data.comment: Text displayed in the text of the FactTypeRequiresInternalUniquenessContraintError. {0}=fact type display context

data.name: ModelError.FactType.RequiresReading.CompactMessage
data.value: Fact type requires at least one reading.
data.comment: Text displayed in the text of the FactTypeRequiresReadingError. Compact form.

data.name: ModelError.FactType.RequiresReading.Message
data.value: At least one reading is required for {0}.
data.comment: Text displayed in the text of the FactTypeRequiresReadingError. {0}=fact type display context

data.name: ModelError.FactTypeInstance.ObjectifyingInstanceRequired.CompactMessage
data.comment: Text displayed when an external identifier is needed for a FactTypeInstance. Compact form. {0}=instance.

Field 0 is the name of the role player, field 1 is the derived name of the instance, field 2 is the model name, field 3 is the name of the first facttype name, field 4 is a placeholder for additional fact types.

data.name: ModelException.CardinalityConstraint.InvalidRangeText

data.name: ModelException.Constraint.EnforceNoForeignFactTypes
data.value: A constraint must be attached to a fact type in the same model as the constraint.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to attached facts from an external model to a constraint.

data.name: ModelException.Constraint.EnforceSingleFactTypeForInternalConstraint
data.value: Internal constraint can only have one associated fact. The IsInternal property must be cleared before adding roles from a second fact type to the constraint.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to attached more than one fact type to an internal constraint.

data.name: ModelError.ConstraintRoleProjection.AutomaticProjectionUnavailable.Text
data.value: Automatic projection is unavailable because the join path does not contain the exactly one path node with a matching type (the same type or a subtype) for this constrained role.
data.comment: Automatic projection is explicitly requested for a constrained role in a joined constraint sequence when a single node of a matching type does not exist in the role path.

data.name: ModelError.ConstraintRoleProjection.AutomaticProjectionUnavailableForAutomaticJoinPath.Text
data.value: Automatic projection is unavailable for an automatically created join path.
data.comment: Block automatic projection on automatic join paths. Projection is handled as part of the automatic join path creation.

data.name: ModelException.ConstraintRoleSequence.AutomaticJoinPathNotAvailable
data.value: Automatic join path not available for this constraint role sequence.

data.name: ModelException.ConstraintRoleSequenceHasRole.EnforceNoRolePlayerChange

data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to directly modify role players on the ConstraintRoleSequenceHasRole relationship.

data.name: ModelError.ConstraintRoleSequence.JoinPathRequiredError.CompactText

data.name: ModelError.ConstraintRoleSequence.JoinPathRequiredError.Text

data.name: ModelException.EntityTypeInstance.InvalidEntityTypeParent

data.name: ModelException.EntityTypeInstance.InvalidRolesPreferredIdentifier

data.name: ModelException.EntityTypeInstance.EnforceRoleUniqueness

data.name: ModelException.EntityTypeSubtypeInstance.DuplicateSupertypeInstance

data.name: ModelException.EntityTypeSubtypeInstance.EnforceInitialSubtypeInstance

data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to modify the EntityTypeSubtypeInstance role of the EntityTypeSubtypeInstanceHasSupertypeInstance relationship

data.name: ModelException.ExclusiveOrConstraintCoupler.DirectExclusionConstraintEdit
data.value: Roles on an ExclusionConstraint linked to a MandatoryConstraint with an ExclusiveOrCoupler should be edited indirectly via the MandatoryConstraint.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to directly edit roles on an ExclusionConstraint that participates in an ExclusiveOrCoupler relationship.

data.name: ModelException.ExclusiveOrConstraintCoupler.InconsistentConstraintRolesOrModality
data.value: An ExclusiveOr coupling between a MandatoryConstraint and ExclusionConstraint requires a single-column exclusion constraint with the same roles and modality as the MandatoryConstraint.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to form an ExclusiveOrConstraintCoupler relationship between incompatible MandatoryConstraint and ExclusionConstraint elements.

data.name: ModelException.Fact.AddReading.InvalidReadingText
data.value: Reading text is not in a valid format.
data.comment: The error message that is returned when attempting to add a new reading to a fact type and the text is not valid. Validate reading text must have the number of placeholders equal to the number of roles in the FactType. The replacement fields must be ordered and identified using String.Format replacement syntax. For example: "{0} has {1}".

data.name: ModelException.FactType.EnforceNoImplicitBooleanValueTypeRolePlayerChange
data.value: The role associated with an implicit boolean value type cannot be changed.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to modify a role player associated with an implicit boolean value.

data.name: ModelException.FactType.EnforceNoRoleMigration
data.value: A Role must remain with the FactType it was originally associated with.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to move a role to a different FactType.

data.name: ModelException.FactType.EnforceRolePlayerNotNestingType
data.value: A role player cannot be the type objectifying the role's parent fact type.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to use the same type as both a role player and the nesting type of a fact type.

data.name: ModelException.FactTypeInstance.DirectionPopulationOfImpliedInstances
data.value: Sample population of a FactType implied by an Objectification relationship or a SubtypeFact that provides the preferred identification path is implicit. Direct population is not allowed.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to add a FactTypeInstance to an implied population.

data.name: ModelException.FactTypeInstance.InconsistentRoleOwners
data.value: All roles in a fact type instance must be owned by the same fact type.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to add roles from different fact types to a role sequence owned by a fact type instance.

data.name: ModelException.FactTypeInstance.EnforceFixedRoleInstance
data.value: The role players of a FactTypeInstanceHasRoleInstance relationship cannot be changed.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to modify either role player on a FactTypeInstanceHasRoleInstance relationship.

data.name: ModelException.FactTypeInstance.EnforceRoleUniqueness
data.value: FactTypeRoleInstance.Role must be unique in the FactTypeRoleInstance collection.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to add a FactTypeRoleInstance with a duplicate Role to the FactTypeRoleInstance collection.

data.name: ModelException.Model.DuplicateName.Text
data.value: The name '{0}' is already in use in this model.
data.comment: Exception message when a name change in the editor attempts to introduce a duplicate name into the model.

data.name: ModelException.ModelErrorCategory.TypeNotDerivedFromModelErrorCategory
data.value: The type specified for the ModelErrorDisplayFilterAttribute must be derived from ModelErrorCategory.
data.comment: Exception message when a ModelErrorDisplayFilterAttribute is initialized with a type that does not derive from ModelErrorCategory.

data.name: ModelException.Objectification.DirectModificationOfImpliedElement
data.value: FactTypes, role players, and the associated internal constraints implied by an Objectification relationship cannot be directly modified.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to modify roles, constraints, and role players on elements implied by an Objectification relationship.

data.name: ModelException.ObjectificationInstance.DirectModificationOfImpliedEntityTypeInstance
data.value: Entity instances implied through an objectification pattern are managed automatically via the corresponding FactTypeInstance collection.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to modify an EntityTypeInstance implied by a FactTypeInstance and an internal preferred identifier on the objectified FactType.

data.name: ModelException.ObjectificationInstance.IncompleteRolePlayers
data.value: Creation or modification an ObjectificationInstance requires fully constructed endpoint instances with instance owners that match the Objectification FactType and EntityType.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to create an ObjectificationInstance will partially constructed endpoint instances.

data.name: ModelException.Objectification.ImpliedFactTypesCannotBeObjectified
data.value: A FactType that is implied by an Objectification cannot be objectified.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to objectify a fact type that is implied by another objectification.

data.name: ModelException.Objectification.ImpliedMustBeImpliedAndIndependentAndCannotPlayRoleInNonImpliedFact
data.value: Implied objectifications must be implied, must be independent (if possible), and must only play roles in implied fact types.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to change an explicit Objectification to implied when it does not match the implied objectification pattern or is not independent (if possible) or plays a Role in a non-implied FactType.

data.name: ModelException.Objectification.ImpliedObjectificationNotAllowed
data.value: Implied objectifications can not be operated on via this method.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to operate on an implied objectification by a method that only accepts explicit objectifications.

data.name: ModelException.ObjectType.EnforceIsIndependentPattern
data.value: IsIndependent can apply only to an object type with no mandatory roles that do not relate to its preferred identifier.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to set the IsIndependent property on an object type that plays mandatory roles that are not part of its preferred identification scheme.

data.name: ModelException.ObjectType.EnforcePreferredIdentifierForEntityType
data.value: An object type with a preferred identifier must be an entity type.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to set both a primary identifier and a value type on the same object type.

data.name: ModelException.ObjectType.EnforceValueTypeNotNestingType
data.value: An object type cannot be both a value type and an objectified fact type.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to make an object type both a value type and an objectified fact type.

data.name: ModelException.ObjectTypeInstance.EnforceFixedRolePlayers
data.value: The role players of an ObjectTypeHasObjectTypeInstance relationship cannot be changed.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to change the role players of an ObjectTypeHasObjectTypeInstance relationship.

data.name: ModelException.Reading.DuplicateSignature.Text

data.comment: Exception message when a reading signature change in the editor attempts to introduce a duplicate signature into the model.

data.name: ModelException.Reading.IsPrimary.ReadOnlyWhenFalse

data.comment: Exception message output when an attempt is made to set the IsPrimaryForReadingOrder or IsPrimaryForFactType properties of a Reading to false.

data.name: ModelException.ReferenceMode.AmbiguousName

data.comment: Exception message output when multiple reference modes are found with the same name

data.name: ModelException.ReferenceMode.EnforceGeneralPattern

data.comment: Exception message when the trivial general reference mode format string pattern is violated

data.name: ModelException.ReferenceMode.EnforcePopularPattern

data.comment: Exception message when the popular reference mode format string pattern is violated

data.name: ModelException.ReferenceMode.EnforceUnitBasedPattern

data.comment: Exception message when the unit based reference mode format string pattern is violated

data.name: ModelException.ReferenceMode.EnforceUniqueFormatString

data.comment: Exception message when the unique format string rule is violated for reference modes

data.name: ModelException.ReferenceMode.EnforceUniqueModeName
data.value: Reference mode names must be unique across the model.
data.comment: Exception message when the unique reference mode name rule is violated

data.name: ModelException.ReferenceMode.IntrinsicRefModesDontChange

data.name: ModelException.ReferenceMode.ReferenceModesKindNotEmpty

data.comment: Exception message when the pattern for a popular reference mode kind is violated.

data.name: ModelException.ReferenceModeKind.EnforceUnitBasedPattern

data.comment: Exception message when the pattern for a unit based reference mode kind is violated.

data.name: ModelException.ReferenceModeKind.EnforceUniqueFormatString

data.comment: Exception message when the unique format string rule is violated for reference mode kinds

data.name: ModelException.Role.IsMandatoryRequiresAttachedFactType
data.value: A Role must be owned by a FactType to set the IsMandatory property.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to set the IsMandatory property on an unattached role. IsMandatory creates an internal constraint, which is owned by an FactType, so cannot be realized if the parent FactType is unknown.

data.name: ModelException.RoleInstance.EnforceInitialRole
data.value: Role instances cannot be detached from the initial Role.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to modify the Role of a RoleInstance.

data.name: ModelException.SubtypeFact.ConstraintAndRolePatternFixed
data.value: The role and constraint patterns of a subtype relationship cannot be modified.

data.name: ModelException.SubtypeFact.Cycle
data.value: A cycle has been detected in a chain of subtype relationships. A subtype must not be the direct or indirect subtype of its supertype.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to add a subtype relationship where the subtype is a direct or indirect subtype of the supertype.

data.name: ModelException.SubtypeFact.MetaRolesMustBeUsedOnSubtypeFact
data.value: The SubtypeMetaRole and SupertypeMetaRole can only be used with a SubtypeFact.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to attach SubtypeMetaRole or SuperTypeMetaRole objects to a FactType that is not a SubtypeFact.

data.name: ModelException.SubtypeFact.NotNested
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to nest a SubtypeFact.

data.name: ModelException.SubtypeFact.ProvidesPreferredIdentifierInvalid
data.value: The preferred identification path cannot be turned off and can only be turned on if the subtype does not have an explicit preferred identifier.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to change the SubtypeFact.ProvidesPreferredIdentifier property to false.

data.name: ModelException.SubtypeFact.RolePlayersTypesNotMixed
data.value: The subtype and supertype of a subtyping relationship must either be entity types or value types, not one of each.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to mix EntityType and ValueType role players on a SubtypeFact.

data.name: ModelException.SubtypeMetaRole.OnlyAllowsImplicitConstraints
data.value: A SubtypeMetaRole cannot only be constrained by implicit single-role uniqueness and mandatory constraints.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to constraint a SubtypeMetaRole with a constraint other than the implicit uniqueness and mandatory constraints.

data.name: ModelException.SupertypeMetaRole.ExclusionMustBeSingleColumn
data.value: An Exclusion constraint including a SubtypeFact is limited to a single column.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to mix Roles and SupertypeMetaRoles in the same multi-column Exclusion constraint.

data.name: ModelException.SupertypeMetaRole.UnsupportedConstraintType
data.value: A SupertypeMetaRole can only be constrained by an implicit single-role uniqueness constraint, a DisjunctiveMandatory constraint, a single-column Exclusion constraint, or the subset role of a single-column Subset constraint.
data.comment: Exception message when an attempt is made to constraint a SupertypeMetaRole with a constraint other than the implicit uniqueness constraint, disjunctive mandatory, single-column exclusion, or (subset role of) single-column subset constraints.

data.name: ModelException.UnaryRoleCardinalityConstraint.UnaryOnly

data.name: ModelException.UniquenessConstraint.InvalidPreferredIdentifierPreConditions

data.name: RingConstraintType.Description.Acyclic
data.value: Acyclic: No A may cycle back to itself via one or more traversals through “A relates to A”.

data.name: RingConstraintType.Description.Antisymmetric
data.value: Antisymmetric: If A1 relates to A2 and A1 is not A2 then it is impossible that A2 relates to A1.

data.name: RingConstraintType.Description.Asymmetric
data.value: Asymmetric: If A1 relates to A2 then it is impossible that A2 relates to A1.

data.name: RingConstraintType.Description.Intransitive
data.value: Intransitive: If A1 relates to A2 and A2 relates to A3 then it is impossible that A1 relates to A3.

data.name: RingConstraintType.Description.Irreflexive
data.value: Irreflexive: No A relates to itself.

data.name: RingConstraintType.Description.PurelyReflexive
data.value: Purely Reflexive: If A1 relates to some A2 then A1 = A2.

data.name: RingConstraintType.Description.Reflexive
data.value: Reflexive: If A1 relates to some A2 then A1 relates to itself.

data.name: RingConstraintType.Description.StronglyIntransitive
data.value: Strongly Intransitive: If A1 relates to some A2 then it is not true that A1 is indirectly related to A2 by repeatedly applying this fact type.

data.name: RingConstraintType.Description.Symmetric
data.value: Symmetric: If A1 relates to A2 then A2 relates to A1.

data.name: RingConstraintType.Description.Transitive
data.value: Transitive: If A1 relates to A2 and A2 relates to A3 then A1 relates to A3.

data.name: ObjectModel.ObjectType.CardinalityDisplay.Description
data.value:
Set the cardinality of a population for this object type. The following patterns are recognized:
Range with a zero lower bound: 0..n, ..n, <n, <=n Range with no upper bound: >n, >=n, n.. Fixed range: n..m
Cardinality supports multiple non-overlapping ranges and single values. A range of 0 indicates that an empty population is allowed. For example, 0,4.. will allow either an empty population or a population with four or more instances.
data.comment: Description for the <see cref="ObjectModel.ObjectType.CardinalityDisplay"/>

data.name: ObjectModel.ObjectType.CardinalityDisplay.DisplayName
data.comment: Display name for the <see cref="ObjectModel.ObjectType.CardinalityDisplay"/>

Cardinality supports multiple non-overlapping ranges and single values. A range of 0 indicates that an empty population is allowed. For example, 0,4.. will allow either an empty population or a population with four or more instances.

data.name: ObjectModel.ValueConstraint.StringDelimiter
data.comment: The string delimiter character. Used to open and close strings. Doubling this character in a string results in the string in the final result.

data.name: ObjectModel.ValueConstraint.ValueDelimiter
data.comment: String used to delimit the min- and max-values of a value range.

data.name: ObjectModel.ValueConstraint.ValueRangeRegexPattern
data.comment: A regex pattern used for extracting parts of a single value range. This string contains a number of other resource values, escaped for use in a regex expression. The format string and replacements are: (?n)\s*((?<MinClosedInclusion>{2})|(?<MinOpenInclusion>{4}))?\s*(?<MinValue>(((?!{1})[^{0}])+|({0}.*?{0})+)*)\s*(?<RangeDelimiter>{1})?\s*(?<MaxValue>(((?!({3}|{5}))[^{0}])+|({0}.*?{0})+)*)\s*((?<MaxClosedInclusion>{3})|(?<MaxOpenInclusion>{5}))?\s* {0}=ObjectModel.ValueConstraint.StringDelimiter {1}=ObjectModel.ValueConstraint.ValueDelimiter The remaining replacements are trimmed for leading/trailing whitespace {2}=ObjectModel.ValueConstraint.ClosedInclusion.LowerDelimiter {3}=ObjectModel.ValueConstraint.ClosedInclusion.UpperDelimiter {4}=ObjectModel.ValueConstraint.OpenInclusion.LowerDelimiter {5}=ObjectModel.ValueConstraint.OpenInclusion.UpperDelimiter

data.name: ObjectModel.ValueType
data.comment: The display name used for an ObjectType when IsValueType is true

data.name: ObjectModel.ValueType.DefaultNamePattern
data.comment: The base name used to create a name for a new ValueType. This is a format string with {0} being the placeholder for the number placement.

data.name: ObjectModel.ValueType.AutoCreateReferenceModeNamePattern
data.comment: Used to automatically turn a value type into an entity type with a reference mode when IsValueType is set to false and the ValueType has downstream value roles. Replacement field {0} is the name of the exisiting type and field {1} is used to insert a number to ensure that the name is unique. {0}Values{1} is the default format.

data.name: ORMModelBrowserDynamicColor.Background
data.comment: The display name for the dynamic model browser background color.

data.name: ORMModelBrowserDynamicColor.Background.Description
data.value: The background color in the ORM model browser for elements in this group.
data.comment: The description of the dynamic background color in the ORM model browser.

data.name: ORMModelBrowserDynamicColor.Category
data.comment: The display name for the category used for custom model browser colors.

data.name: ORMModelBrowserDynamicColor.Foreground
data.comment: The display name for the dynamic model browser foreground color.

data.name: ORMModelBrowserDynamicColor.Foreground.Description
data.value: The foreground color for text in the ORM model browser for elements in this group.
data.comment: The description of the dynamic foreground color in the ORM model browser.

data.name: Subquery.SignatureFormat
data.comment: The general structure for the signature of a subquery. {0}=parameter list, {1}=role list

data.name: Subquery.NamedArgumentFormat
data.comment: The format string used to combine a parameter or role and and the parameter or role type in a subquery signature. {0}=item name, {1}=item type

data.name: SubtypeFact.ComponentNameFormat
data.comment: String for generating a component name for a subtype. The {0} replacement field is used for the subtype component name; {1} for the supertype.

data.name: SubtypeFact.DefaultReadingText
data.comment: The format string for the default reading of a subtype. The {0} replacement field is used for the subtype element name; {1} for the supertype.

data.name: SubtypeFact.ElementNameFormat
data.comment: The format string for the generated name of a subtype relationship. The {0} replacement field is used for the subtype element name; {1} for the supertype.

data.name: SubtypeFact.PredicateInverseReading
data.comment: The inverse instance reading for the predicate created by creating a sub type relationship.

data.name: SubtypeFact.PredicateReading
data.comment: The instance reading for the forward predicate created by creating a subtype relationship.

data.name: Verbalization.ReportSnippetsDefaultDescription
data.comment: The description for the default verbalization report snippets.

data.name: Verbalization.ReportSnippetsTypeDescription
data.comment: The description for the snippets associated with the verbalization reports.

data.name: Verbalization.SnippetsDefaultDescription
data.comment: The description for the default verbalization snippets for the core model.

data.name: Verbalization.SnippetsTypeDescription
data.comment: The description for the verbalization snippets associated with the core model.

data.name: VerbalizationTarget.HtmlReport.DisplayName
data.comment: Description for target HtmlReport customizations. Displays in the verbalization customizations dropdown in the options page.

data.name: VerbalizationTarget.HtmlReport.CommandName
data.comment: Description for target HtmlReport command name. Displays in the GenerateReport submenu on the context menu.

data.name: VerbalizationTarget.VerbalizationBrowser.DisplayName
data.comment: Description for target VerbalizationBrowser customizations. Displays in the verbalization customizations dropdown in the options page.
